Pedagogy

The Science & Art of Teaching

We fondly call it the science and art of 'Teaching'. We train teachers in methods, principles, and practices to help students learn better. Pedagogy is not only about what we teach (the content), but also how it is taught (the approach).

Learning Theories
  • Constructivism
  • Behaviorism
  • Experiential learning
Teaching Methods
  • Lectures & discussions
  • Group work & peer learning
  • Hands-on activities & digital tools
Student Needs
  • Age & background sensitivity
  • Different learning abilities
  • Individual interests & motivation
Assessment Strategies
  • Formative feedback
  • Quizzes, tests & projects
  • Continuous monitoring
Learning Environment
  • Engaging classroom setup
  • Effective online learning environments
  • Supportive social & cultural context

Classroom Practice

Preparation & Teaching Methods for Effective Learning

Lesson Planning Skills
  • Structuring lessons with clear learning objectives
  • Using Bloom’s Taxonomy for higher-order thinking
  • Planning activities for different learner levels
Subject Pedagogy Training
  • Math conceptually, Science through experiments, Languages via storytelling
  • Problem-solving & inquiry-based strategies
  • Project-based learning approaches
Classroom Management Techniques
  • Setting routines & rules
  • Managing disruptive behavior positively
  • Balancing group, pair, and individual work
Use of Teaching Aids
  • Chalkboard, flashcards, charts, models
  • ICT tools: smart boards, simulations, educational apps
Inclusive Teaching
  • Differentiating instruction for slow & gifted learners
  • Supporting students with learning difficulties
  • Culturally responsive teaching approaches

Actual Classroom Performance

Communication & Presentation Skills

Voice modulation, body language, and eye contact with clear explanations and proper pacing.

Questioning & Feedback Techniques

Asking open-ended, probing, reflective questions, encouraging student questions, and giving constructive feedback.

Active Learning Strategies

Role plays, debates, discussions, hands-on experiments, peer teaching, and gamification in the classroom.

Time Management in Class

Balancing teaching, practice, and discussion without over-explaining one topic at the cost of others.

Assessment for Learning

Quick formative assessments (quizzes, exit tickets, think-pair-share), real-time monitoring, and adaptive teaching.

Interview Preparation & Performance

Understanding the Interview Structure

HR, technical, group discussion, case study, teaching demo – know the stages & expectations clearly.

Personal Branding

Deliver a confident self-introduction and highlight achievements effectively in just 1–2 minutes.

Content Mastery

Revise subject knowledge, stay updated with current affairs, and research the school/company.

Mock Interview Drills

Practice strengths, weaknesses, situational Qs. Record and review answers for improvement.

Resume & Portfolio

Showcase achievements clearly. Teachers prepare sample lesson plans & teaching portfolios.

Body Language

Maintain eye contact, posture, and confidence. Avoid nervous habits like fillers or fidgeting.

Communication Skills

Be clear & concise. Use STAR method (Situation, Task, Action, Result) to structure answers.

Handling Tough Questions

Pause, think, and answer calmly. If unsure, acknowledge & redirect positively.

Closing the Interview

Ask smart questions, thank the panel, and leave a lasting positive impression.

Core Academic Subjects

  • English – Literature, Grammar, Writing, Comprehension
  • Second Language – Hindi / Kannada / Tamil / Telugu / Sanskrit / French
  • Mathematics – Arithmetic, Algebra, Geometry, Trigonometry
  • Science – Classes 5–7: General, Classes 8–9: Physics, Chemistry, Biology
  • Social Studies – History, Geography, Civics

Skill & Creative Subjects

  • Computer Science / IT – Coding, Digital Literacy
  • Art & Craft – Drawing, Painting, Creative Arts
  • Music / Dance / Theatre – Classical, Western, Vocal, Instrumental
  • Physical Education & Yoga – Fitness, Sports, Health

Value & Developmental Subjects

  • Moral Science / Value Education – Ethics, Personality
  • Environmental Studies (EVS) – Till Class 5
  • General Knowledge (GK) / Current Affairs
